info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 3:46PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central La Paz and northeastern Yuma Counties through 430 PM MST... At 346 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 22 miles southeast of Vicksburg Junction, or 35 miles west of Tonopah, moving northwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salome. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 39 and 66. US Highway 60 between mile markers 48 and 52. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
